title: Loose peers every 5 to 7 days
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `geth version`

Version: 1.12.0-stable
Architecture: amd64
Go Version: go1.19
Operating System: linux
GOPATH=
GOROOT=

CL client & version: e.g. lighthouse/nimbus/prysm@v1.0.0

prysm - beacon-chain-v4.0.6-linux-amd64

OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX

Linux u59 5.15.7-gentoo #7 SMP Tue Jan 25 20:44:26 MST 2022 x86_64 Intel(R) Celeron(R) N5095 @ 2.00GHz GenuineIntel GNU/Linux

#### Expected behaviour

Keep peer count normal.

#### Actual behaviour

I loose peers after geth runs for 5 to 7 days and reboot to fix.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Just start geth and wait.

**DESCRIPTION:** 

Every 5 to 7 days I discover (through my grafana dashboard) that my peer count is too low (like under 10).  It is usually around 45 when operating normally.

I usually just reboot to fix it.  This causes "Slots behind" to go up and it takes 10 - 15 minutes to recover.  I would like to determine what is causing the loss of peers.  Can you suggest how I might troubleshoot this?

This has been happening for months, but I am only now posting this, hoping it would be fixed in the several releases I have installed since it started happening.  I do not recall exactly when it first started happening (i.e., what version).  It was running for almost a year without this happening.

Please advise...  THANKS!
